47A020E5DB9B49B7A3E42BD495C4DA5F.description:
Calculate the mean, median, and mode to describe an
ordered data set (mode does not require calculation, only
observation and counting).

2562C831EDF84589B213F2198A2AF393.description:
Calculate measures of central tendency (mean, median, and
mode) to describe a data set. Analyze data sets to determine which
measure of central tendency appropriately describes the distribution of
data. (E)

D7A7D235B0854EC8843701DFEAA3C909.description:
Generate questions that can be answered with a given graph
(e.g., line plots, bar graphs, and line graphs). Collect, organize, and
graph data from observations, surveys, and experiments that
appropriately represent the data set. (E)

C82BA9FD25C5401095714CC43F2F9643.description:
Formulate questions that can be addressed with categorical
and numerical data and make predictions about the data. Collect,
organize, and graph data from observations, surveys, and experiments
using line plots with fractional intervals, histograms, or other graphical
representations that appropriately represent the data set. (E)

3EB47417B6A743E78533FB50FF1DA3AE.description:
Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with whole
number side lengths when given the formula V = l × w × h, a model,
and all required measurements.

8E35434F72314EC8BD8008279A007968.description:
Apply the formulas V = l × w × h and V = B × h for right
rectangular prisms to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with
whole-number edge lengths to solve real-world problems and other
mathematical problems. (E)

37D5A1B9F71940A3BD9301DDD9090336.description:
Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with whole
number side lengths by packing it with unit cubes. (E)

8C697C1A2E2B42D4BACEDDDD58F5F11B.description:
Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with whole-number
side lengths by packing it with unit cubes, and show that the volume is
the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths or
multiplying the height by the area of the base. (E)

D7669ED678B84DD2BC3D51A564D1D87F.description:
Solve real-world and other mathematical problems
involving the perimeter of triangles, parallelograms, and
trapezoids and area of triangles and parallelograms when given
the formula.

16D5985F397A49BB85B55C640F4A7BB3.description:
Develop and use formulas for the area of triangles,
parallelograms, and trapezoids. Solve real-world and other
mathematical problems that involve perimeter and area of triangles,
parallelograms, and trapezoids, using appropriate units for measures.
(E)

A6CF7859FA2646B989F94CDBA4079D09.description:
Find the area of rectangles and triangles with fractional side
lengths limited to halves by modeling with unit squares or multiplying
the side lengths.

FD520317B5B5448E8FC3847D31A3FC1F.description:
Find the area of a rectangle with fractional side lengths by
modeling with unit squares of the appropriate unit fraction side lengths,
and show that the area is the same as would be found by multiplying
the side lengths. Multiply fractional side lengths to find areas of
rectangles, and represent fraction products as rectangular areas.

F323537C3B0342DF8F9352EC195D9DA3.description:
Given the conversions, convert among measurements of
time (e.g., days in a week, hours in a day, minutes in an hour) and
length (e.g., inches in a foot, feet in a yard, centimeters in a meter) in
real-world problems. (E)

5A74D9B2752F437E8ED3DBA48679D8FB.description:
Convert among different-sized standard measurement units
within a given measurement system and use these conversions in
solving multi-step, real-world problems.

10DAAAC7D65B4442A7C946235F15D29D.description:
Model right, acute, and obtuse triangles using appropriate
tools (e.g., ruler or straightedge, compass, or technology) and identify
the radius and diameter in circles.

7C21AF9C6A1743B09FE37474756B92A7.description:
Identify, describe, and draw triangles (right, acute, obtuse) and
circles using appropriate tools (e.g., ruler or straightedge, compass,
and technology). Define and model the relationship between radius
and diameter.

FF23FE5BCAE94B06AD654627B8D2A224.description:
Represent real-world problems by graphing ordered pairs
in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. (E)

99869B231EFF473D9A3EE6561C645E81.description:
Represent real-world problems and equations by graphing
ordered pairs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane, and interpret
coordinate values of points in the context of the situation.

17E67882DBF64DDD9A3B94E8D932955F.description:
Solve one-step real-world money problems involving
addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division with decimals to
hundredths place. (E)

63C90F2783C340158CD1D938DB81F9F0.description:
Solve real-world problems involving addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division with decimals to hundredths including
problems that involve money in decimal notation (e.g., by using
equations, models or drawings, and strategies based on place value or
properties of operations to represent the problem). (E)

32698B8FAE0348AD8754931EF1E9C287.description:
Add and subtract decimals to hundredths. Multiply, and
divide decimals to hundredths using models or drawings and
strategies based on place value or the properties of operations.

4E1253005D1C4D8AAB27FB39F47CA452.description:
Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths,
using models or drawings and strategies based on place value or the
properties of operations. Describe the strategy and explain the
reasoning.

EFB502903EAE493DBBFE9736B326155C.description:
Solve real-world problems involving the division of a
fraction by a fraction or a whole number up to four using visual
fraction models. (E)

9DB5C3F2801C45D9AEC54299B2EBC379.description:
Solve real-world problems involving division of fractions and
mixed numbers (e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to
represent the problem). (E)

24BABEDAE1434B15BD9416D54ACA68A5.description:
Solve real-world problems involving multiplication of a
fraction by a fraction or a whole number up to four using visual
fraction models. (E)

8FC0F6290B5C42E2AC9A7FF02395A1A0.description:
Solve real-world problems involving multiplication of fractions,
including mixed numbers (e.g., by using visual fraction models and
equations to represent the problem). (E)

E802C7A2B6FC442987205AA3E07907BA.description:
Use visual fraction models to divide a fraction by a fraction
or a whole number up to four.

9780229C7AB545A892A15E331AA2ADAD.description:
Use visual fraction models and numbers to divide a fraction by
a fraction or a whole number. (E)

2F46A14F773F4B878538134D5903A355.description:
Use visual fraction models to multiply a fraction by a fraction
or a whole number up to four.

D9F7CA1CD19446A0A3B257499D0E3A9D.description:
Use visual fraction models to multiply a fraction by a fraction
or a whole number. (E)

EDBD88EF2E304ED4BE9D62CA36267B0C.description:
Solve real-world problems involving addition and subtraction
of fractions with unlike denominators. Limit denominators to 2, 4, 5,
and 10. (E)

2EB3F884787C422594BC653F95A48CD0.description:
Solve real-world problems involving addition and subtraction
of fractions referring to the same whole, including cases of unlike
denominators (e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to
represent the problem). Use benchmark fractions and number sense of
fractions to estimate mentally and assess whether the answer is
reasonable. (E)

270EF3AA627C4BF4A5C673BD57AA2CCE.description:
Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators
limiting denominators to 2, 4, 5, and 10.

9DD7414018154E57A093B4858B4B745D.description:
Add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers with unlike
denominators using strategies or the standard algorithm.

E63464550BFF4D90AC07D2A7E41DE568.description:
Solve real-world problems involving multiplication and
division of whole numbers with or without remainders within 200. (E)

69842B5FFCB347AB83ECF1B1ABF35432.description:
Solve real-world problems involving multiplication and division
of whole numbers (e.g., by using equations to represent the problem).
In division problems that involve a remainder, explain how the
remainder affects the solution to the problem. (E)

CCE4FB98D52A4C769AB8E18C39A7244D.description:
Find whole number quotients with and without remainders
up to 200 with three-digit dividends and two-digit divisors using any
strategy. Describe the strategy used such as place value strategies,
properties of operations, and the relationship between multiplication
and division.

1757EC4FDBEB40358FFDEC65C5663351.description:
Find whole-number quotients and remainders with up to
four-digit dividends and two-digit divisors using strategies based on
place value, the properties of operations, and/or the relationship
between multiplication and division. Describe the strategy and explain
the reasoning used. (E)

9DFFC6ABBB604D33B45512C6A0971D78.description:
Model percents as part of 100 using pictures or diagrams.
(E)

F9CCF0C28CB54F63B4DD8A2BB67F0BE7.description:
Model percents as parts of 100 using pictures or diagrams and
identify the equivalent fraction.

82B5D31601454509A437004DE5C45994.description:
Use whole number exponents from one to three to denote
powers of 10 from 10 to 1,000 and explain the relationship of the
zeros in the base and product.

1770FA33276E486C81655A77C4FA1A72.description:
Explain patterns in the number of zeros of the product when
multiplying a number by powers of 10, and explain patterns in the
placement of the decimal point when a decimal is multiplied or divided
by a power of 10. Use whole-number exponents to denote powers of
10.

AA94F65B5BF84C03AF9A6D7B9A55B705.description:
Represent fractions as parts of a whole, parts of a set, and
division of whole numbers by whole numbers. (E)

A99CA235CFD64DA998BD3916602577A5.description:
Explain different interpretations of fractions, including as parts
of a whole, parts of a set, and division of whole numbers by whole
numbers.

C22A33E436584AF29D189CA4DD3BA634.description:
Use a number line to compare two fractions with same or
different denominators, two mixed numbers, or two decimals to the
hundredths place. Record the comparisons using symbols >, <, or =.
Limit denominators to 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10 and 12. (E)

8DFF5270947C496E9062602D756F73D1.description:
Use a number line to compare and order fractions, mixed
numbers, and decimals to thousandths. Write the results using > , = ,
and < symbols. (E)
